sen.j: 伊藤東涯（いとう とうがい、寛文10年4月28日 (旧暦)（1670年6月15日） - 元文元年7月17日 (旧暦)（1736年8月23日））は、江戸時代中期の儒学者。
sen.e: Togai ITO (June 15, 1670 to August 23, 1736) was a Confucianism scholar in the mid Edo period.
Togai ITO (June 15, 1670 to August 23, 1736) was a Confucianism scholar in the mid Edo period.
Togai ITO (June 15, 1670 to August 23, 1736) was a Confucianism scholar in the mid Edo period.

sen.j: 儒学者伊藤仁斎の長男で、その私塾古義堂の2代目。
sen.e: He was the eldest son of Jinsai ITO, a Confusian scholar, and the second generation master of the private school Kogido (Confucianism school taught by Jinsai ITO).
He was the eldest son of Jinsai ITO, a Confusian scholar, and the second generation master of the private school Kogido (Confucianism school taught by Jinsai ITO).
He was the eldest son of Jinsai ITO, a Confusian scholar, and the second generation master of the private school Kogido (Confucianism school taught by Jinsai ITO).

sen.j: 母の嘉那は尾形光琳・尾形乾山の従姉に当たる。
sen.e: His mother Kana was the cousin of Korin OGATA and Kenzan OGATA.
His mother Kana was the cousin of Korin OGATA and Kenzan OGATA.
His mother Kana was the cousin of Korin OGATA and Kenzan OGATA.

sen.j: 名は長胤（ながつぐ）。
sen.e: His name was Nagatsugu.
His name was Nagatsugu.
His name was Nagatsugu.

sen.j: 字は原蔵・源蔵・元蔵。
sen.e: The characters were Genzo.
The characters were Genzo.
The characters were Genzo.

sen.j: 諡は紹述先生。
sen.e: His Buddhist name was Shojutsu Sensei.
His Buddhist name was Shojutsu Sensei.
His Buddhist name was Shojutsu Sensei.

sen.j: 温厚な性格の長者で父や弟たちを支えて古義学の興隆の基礎を築いた。
sen.e: He was the chieftain of family with a gentle character that he supported his father and younger brothers, and built the basis for the prosperity of Kogigaku (Study of Ancient Principles).
He was the chieftain of family with a gentle character and supported his father and younger brothers, and built the basis for the prosperity of Kogigaku (Study of Ancient Principles).
He was the chieftain of family with a gentle character and supported his father and younger brothers, and built the basis for the prosperity of Kogigaku (Study of Ancient Principles).

sen.j: 父仁斎の遺した著書の編集・刊行につとめ、自らも「訓幼字義」などを刊行している。
sen.e: He worked for the edit and the publication of the book which father Jinsai left after death, and also published himself "Kunyo Jigi".
He worked for the edit and the publication of the book which his father Jinsai left after death, and also published himself "Kunyo Jigi".
He worked for the edit and the publication of the book which his father Jinsai left after death, and also published himself "Kunyo Jigi".

sen.j: 中国語・中国の制度史・儒教の歴史などの基礎的な分野の研究にも力を入れていた。
sen.e: He also made efforts to the research of basic fields such as Chinese language, history of systems in China, and Confucian history etc.
He also made efforts to research basic fields such as Chinese language, history of systems in China, and Confucian history etc.
sen.cmt: made effort to 動詞に変更
sen.e: He also made efforts to research basic fields such as Chinese language, history of systems in China, and Confucian history etc.

sen.j: また、新井白石、荻生徂徠らとも親交が深かった。
sen.e: Moreover, he was on intimate friendship with Hakuseki ARAI, Sorai OGYU and others.
Moreover, he was on intimate friendship with Hakuseki ARAI, Sorai OGYU and others.
Moreover, he was on intimate friendship with Hakuseki ARAI, Sorai OGYU and others.

sen.j: 東涯の号は、自号である。
sen.e: The title Togai was a title by himself.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The title Togai was a title by himself.
The title Togai was a title by himself.

sen.j: 古義堂が京都の堀川通出水通下るの、堀川 (京都府)の東岸に在ったことに因むものである。
sen.e: It was related to the fact that Kogido was located near Horikwa-dori Street and Demizu-dori Street in Kyoto, the east shore of the Hori-kawa River (Kyoto Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It was related to the fact that Kogido was located near Horikwa-dori Street and Demizu-dori Street in Kyoto, the east shore of the Hori-kawa River (Kyoto Prefecture).
It was related to the fact that Kogido was located near Horikwa-dori Street and Demizu-dori Street in Kyoto, the east shore of the Hori-kawa River (Kyoto Prefecture).

sen.j: 妻は加藤氏、三男をもうける。
sen.e: His wife was from the Kato clan and had three sons.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: His wife was from the Kato clan and had three sons.
His wife was from the Kato clan and had three sons.

sen.j: しかし、長子と次子は早逝してしまい、三子の伊藤善韶（号は東所）が古義堂を継承した。
sen.e: However, the eldest child and the second son had an early death that the third son Zensho (titled Tosho) succeeded to Kogido.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, since the eldest child and the second son had an early death, the third son Zensho (titled Tosho) succeeded to Kogido.
However, since the eldest child and the second son had an early death, the third son Zensho (titled Tosho) succeeded to Kogido.

sen.j: なお元禄16年（1703年）4月に東涯が並河千左衛門へ送った書状のなかに元禄赤穂事件の不忠臣として知られる大野九郎兵衛と伊藤五右衛門の兄弟の消息についての記述がある。
sen.e: Moreover, in the letter which Togai sent to Saemon HEIKASEN in April, 1703, there was news about Kurobei ONO (who was known as a disloyalty retainer of the Genroku Ako Incident) and Goemon ITO's brothers.

Moreover, in the letter which Togai sent to Sensaemon NAMIKAWA in April, 1703, there was news about Kurobei ONO (who was known as a disloyalty retainer of the Genroku Ako Incident) and Goemon ITO's brothers.

Moreover, in the letter which Togai sent to Sensaemon NAMIKAWA in April, 1703, there was news about Kurobei ONO (who was known as a disloyalty retainer of the Genroku Ako Incident) and Goemon ITO's brothers.

sen.j: よって東涯の伊藤家の親族だった可能性が高い。
sen.e: Therefore, the possibility that he was a relative of Togai in the Ito family was high.
Therefore, the possibility that he was a relative of Togai in the Ito family was high.
Therefore, the possibility that he was a relative of Togai in the Ito family was high.
